newsitem.title: USA: Medcath Inc sets shareholder rights plan.
newsitem.headline: Medcath Inc sets shareholder rights plan.

text.p: MedCath Inc said on Wednesday that it has established a shareholder rights plan to assure that shareholders are treated fairly if there is a proposed takeover of the company.
Medcath said it does not know of any attempts of a takeover of the company.
The rights will be exercisable only if a person or group acquires 15 percent or more of MedCath's common stock or announces a tender offer for that amount, Medcath said.
Medcath said each right will entitle shareholders to buy one one-hundredth of a share of a new series of junior participating preferred stock at an exercise price of $120.
Each right would entitle its holder to buy at the right's exercise price a number of the acquiring's company's shares at a discount from its market price, Medcath said.
The rights will encourage any interested parties to negotiate with the board for the acquisition of the company, Medcath said.
The rights distribution will be made on October 28, 1996, payable to shareholders of record on that date. The rights will expire on October 15, 2006.
